meta.label: 1. Train and evaluate forecasting models
meta.description: Train forecasting models and evaluate their performance on historical data

outputRoles.name: MODEL_FOLDER_NAME
outputRoles.label: Trained model folder
outputRoles.description: Folder to save trained forecasting models

outputRoles.name: EVALUATION_DATASET_NAME
outputRoles.label: Performance metrics dataset
outputRoles.description: Performance metrics of forecasting models evaluated on a split of the historical dataset

params.name: TIME_COLUMN
params.label: Time column
params.description: Must be a parsed date

params.name: GRANULARITY
params.label: Frequency
params.description: Frequency of your historical data

params.name: SERIES_COLUMN
params.label: Target column
params.description: Must be numeric

params.name: AUTOML
params.label: Forecasting mode
params.description: AutoML to let Dataiku choose model parameters or Expert to have full control

params.name: NAIVE_MODEL_ACTIVATED
params.label: - Baseline
params.description: Based on the naive/snaive implementation of the R "forecast" package

selectChoices.label: Seasonal: forecast value at previous period
Seasonal: forecast value at previous period with drift correction

params.name: PROPHET_MODEL_ACTIVATED
params.label: - Prophet
params.description: Based on the Prophet implementation of the R "prophet" package.

params.name: PROPHET_MODEL_GROWTH
params.label: ↳ Growth
params.description: Use a linear or logistic trend

params.name: PROPHET_MODEL_MINIMUM
params.label: ↳ Minimum
params.description: Saturating minimum for logistic growth

params.name: PROPHET_MODEL_MAXIMUM
params.label: ↳ Maximum
params.description: Saturating maximum for logistic growth

params.name: PROPHET_MODEL_KWARGS
params.label: ↳ Optional parameters
params.description: Keyword argument ⟶ value cf. cran.r-project.org/web/packages/prophet/prophet.pdf

params.name: NEURALNETWORK_MODEL_ACTIVATED
params.label: - Neural Network
params.description: Based on the nnetar implementation of the R "forecast" package.

params.name: NEURALNETWORK_MODEL_NUMBER_SEASONAL_LAGS
params.label: ↳ Seasonal lags
params.description: Number of seasonal lags used as inputs. Default is 1.

params.name: NEURALNETWORK_MODEL_NUMBER_NON_SEASONAL_LAGS
params.label: ↳ Non-seasonal lags
params.description: Number of non-seasonal lags used as inputs. Leave -1 for automatic selection.

params.name: NEURALNETWORK_MODEL_SIZE
params.label: ↳ Number of neurons
params.description: Number of neurons in the hidden layer. Leave -1 for automatic selection.

params.name: NEURALNETWORK_MODEL_KWARGS
params.label: ↳ Optional parameters
params.description: Keyword argument ⟶ value cf. https://www.rdocumentation.org/packages/forecast/versions/8.13/topics/nnetar

params.name: ARIMA_MODEL_ACTIVATED
params.label: - AutoARIMA
params.description:
Based on the auto.arima implementation of the R "forecast" package.
WARNING: slow for long time series (1000+ records)

params.name: ARIMA_MODEL_STEPWISE
params.label: ↳ Stepwise
params.description: Use stepwise procedure to speed up the search for model parameters

params.name: ARIMA_MODEL_KWARGS
params.label: ↳ Optional parameters
params.description: Keyword argument ⟶ value cf. https://www.rdocumentation.org/packages/forecast/versions/8.13/topics/auto.arima

params.name: SEASONALTREND_MODEL_ACTIVATED
params.label: - Seasonal Trend
params.description: Based on the stlf implementation of the R "forecast" package. WARNING: may not converge for non-seasonal data.

params.name: SEASONALTREND_MODEL_KWARGS
params.label: ↳ Optional parameters
params.description: Keyword argument ⟶ value cf. https://www.rdocumentation.org/packages/forecast/versions/8.13/topics/forecast.stl

params.name: EXPONENTIALSMOOTHING_MODEL_ACTIVATED
params.label: - Exponential Smoothing
params.description: Based on the ets implementation of the R "forecast" package.  WARNING: slow for long time series (1000+ records)

params.name: EXPONENTIALSMOOTHING_MODEL_KWARGS
params.label: ↳ Optional parameters
params.description: Keyword argument ⟶ value cf. https://www.rdocumentation.org/packages/forecast/versions/8.13/topics/ets

params.name: STATESPACE_MODEL_ACTIVATED
params.label: - State Space
params.description:
Based on the tbats implementation of the R "forecast" package.
WARNING: slow for long time series (1000+ records)

params.name: STATESPACE_MODEL_KWARGS
params.label: ↳ Optional parameters
params.description: Keyword argument ⟶ value cf. https://www.rdocumentation.org/packages/forecast/versions/8.13/topics/tbats

params.name: separator_evaluation
params.label: Evaluation
params.description: Split to evaluate performance metrics. The final model will be retrained on the entire sample.

params.name: EVAL_STRATEGY
params.label: Splitting strategy
params.description: Time-based train/test split or cross-validation at multiple cutoffs (slower)

params.name: EVAL_HORIZON
params.label: Forecasting horizon
params.description: Number of future values to predict when evaluating performance metrics

params.name: CROSSVAL_INITIAL
params.label: Initial training
params.description: Number of time steps in the initial train set. If -1, 10 * Horizon is used.

params.name: CROSSVAL_PERIOD
params.label: Cutoff period
params.description: Number of time steps between each split. If -1, 0.5 * Horizon is used.

params.name: external_feature_activated
params.label: Add external features
params.description: Optional numeric features for exogenous time-dependent factors e.g., holidays, special events

params.name: EXT_SERIES_COLUMNS
params.label: External feature columns
params.description: ⚠️  Futures values of external features will be required to forecast
